sentences.english: And upon every high tower, and every fenced wall.
sentences.chinese: 一切高塔和一切堅固的城牆。

sentences.english: "I wonder what is in the great South Tower," she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說，“我想知道南方那個高塔裏有什麼。”

sentences.english: Macao Tower is the member of the world league of high tower.
sentences.chinese: 澳門旅遊塔乃世界高塔聯盟之會員。

sentences.english: Once you’ve built up a stack, separate them into little piles according to who gave them to you.
sentences.chinese: 當你的卡片已經蓋成高塔，把它們按贈送者分開。

sentences.english: This particular valley is a maze of towers and outcroppings.
sentences.chinese: 這特殊的峽谷是一個由高塔和突出物構成的迷宮。

sentences.english: And clear and cold about the tower its loud horn calls.
sentences.chinese: 在高塔旁北風呼嘯，吹響了清越的號角。

sentences.english: A fog lifted over the towering spires of St. Elizabeth’s Cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 聖伊麗莎白大教堂高塔尖頂處的霧氣消散了。

sentences.english: Proceed on to the Merlion Tower for a picturesque view of the Singapore mainland.
sentences.chinese: 前往魚尾獅高塔觀賞美麗如畫的新加坡風景。

sentences.english: He jumps from the tower into the bushes below.
sentences.chinese: 便從高塔往下跳，跳到矮樹叢裏。

sentences.english: Delhi government is involving school kids in cleaning heritage sites like Qutab Minar.
sentences.chinese: 德里政府把學生拉去打掃古特伯高塔等遺址。

sentences.english: It is the second-highest tower in the college, after the Magdalen Great Tower.
sentences.chinese: 它是該學院僅次於莫德林高塔的第二高塔。

sentences.english: It is the second-highest tower in the college, after the Magdalen Great Tower.
sentences.chinese: 它是該學院僅次於莫德林高塔的第二高塔。

sentences.english: She disappeared once more in the open maw of the tower.
sentences.chinese: 她再度消失在了高塔張開的巨口之中。

sentences.english: From a proud tower in the town, death looks gigantically down.
sentences.chinese: 死亡站在高塔上，傲視着下面的一切。

sentences.english: The largest musical clock in Germany clings to one of the towers.
sentences.chinese: 德國最大的音樂鍾就緊貼着此處的一座高塔上。

sentences.english: Climbing up the tower to see the panorama of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 爬上這座高塔可以看到工廠的全景。

definition: tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
main hall of a Buddhist temple
